column5: With all the heavy rains Thunder Bay and area received this weekend a State of Emergency has been declared. Many area roads have been washed out including Hwy 17 west of hwy 130. Anyone planning to use this route will now have to use hwy 102 to access areas west of T Bay. The sewage plant has also been affected and residents have been told not to flush toilets and let water run needlessly. Many homes have flooded and rivers are over their banks. Use exteme caution when travelling through this area to your fishing spots this week. Please check local conditions for updates to the hwy closures.
see this for road closure details:http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/thunde...y.html?cmp=rss phish
